main event: On September 29, 1950 at Sandia Base, N.M., a soldier observed an unidentified aerial object described as oblong, bluish-yellow, and traveling at a speed between a jet and a bomber in a northeast to southeast direction. The observation lasted 3-4 seconds before the object disappeared over mountains.
interesting points: The unidentified aerial object was observed to have a bluish-yellow flame, similar to exhaust, and appeared to be one-third the size of the full moon.
It was estimated to be traveling at approximately 350 to 400 MPH, which is faster than typical aircraft of the time.
The report mentions the absence of sound and odor associated with the object, indicating unusual characteristics.
There was a mention of a trail with bluish and yellow fringes, approximately 4-5 feet in length, suggesting some form of propulsion or emission.

The observation of the object was made under clear weather conditions with bright luminosity, and the report includes specific details such as altitude, duration of observation, and direction of flight.
